trans-unit.source: Represents the writer of the message body.
A message consists of headers and a body.
The headers are buffered and the body is streamed.
Because the body is streamed, the user cannot pass the actual content of the body to a message.
Instead the user must pass a class that knows how to write the body when asked to do so.
This is done by passing a class derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter> to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message>.
A message calls the class derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter> whenever it requires the body to be written using an <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter"></xref> class that explicitly indicates whether to buffer.
If `isBuffered` is `false` then the message calls the write method once and buffers the contents.
`true` if the body writer can be called multiple times; otherwise `false`.
Starts to write body contents for the body writer with specified writer, callback and state.
The writer.
The callback.
The state.
The result of the operation.
Creates a buffered copy of the body.
If <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.IsBuffered%2A> is `true` then the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter> object is returned.
If <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.IsBuffered%2A> is `false` then the contents of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter> up to `maxBufferSize` is returned.
This also calls <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.OnCreateBufferedCopy%28System.Int32%29> as an extensibility point.
The maximum size of the buffer for the body.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter"></xref> that contains a copy of this object.
The maxBufferSize is less than zero.
The body has already been written and cannot be written again, or the body writer is not buffered.
Ends the writing of body contents.
The result of the operation.
Gets a value that indicates whether the write method can be called multiple times.
If `isBuffered` is `false` then the message calls the write method once and buffers the contents.
`true` if the body writer can be called multiple times; otherwise `false`.
Raises an event when the body writer starts to write body contents with specified writer, callback and state.
The writer
The callback
The state.
The asynchronous result.
Provides an extensibility point when the body contents are written.
A class derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter> can override this method to create a buffered copy of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter>.

But the default implementation of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.WriteBodyContents%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter%29> calls <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.OnWriteBodyContents%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter%29>, so overriding just <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.OnWriteBodyContents%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter%29> should be easier and work for most scenarios.
Note that the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter> returned must be buffered, that is <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.IsBuffered%2A> must be `true`.
The maximum size of the buffer for the body.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter"></xref> with the specified maximum buffer size.
Raises an event when the body writer ends writing body contents.
The result of the operation.
When implemented, provides an extensibility point when the body contents are written.
This method must be implemented by classes derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter>.
This is the key method that writes the body.
If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter> is buffered then this method is called only once.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> used to write out the message body.
Writes out the contents of the message body.

The default implementation of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.WriteBodyContents%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter%29> calls <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.OnWriteBodyContents%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter%29>, so overriding <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BodyWriter.OnWriteBodyContents%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter%29> provides the best point of extension.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> used to write out the message body.
writer is `null`.
